intro: Myrcia splendens var. guantanamana, commonly known as the Guantánamo myrtle, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its aromatic, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that range from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants such as eucalyptus and clove. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils near coastal areas. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine and for their aromatic properties.
